description: Construction of pergola to rear garden and new awning to ground floor rear and retention of railing gate to front driveway
decision_conditions: <p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;background-color:#ffffff;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;padding:0pt 0pt 10pt 0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Detailed specification and a drainage layout of at least one suitable sustainable drainage systems (i.e. water butt, raingarden, bioretention planter box, living roof (substrate depth of 80-150 mm excluding the vegetative mat), permeable paving, etc.) shall be submitted to, and approved by the LPA, in consultation with the LLFA. If soakaways i.e. plastic modules and soakaway rings are used, an infiltration test must be carried out to ensure that the capacity of the soil is suitable for infiltration.</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">REASON: </span><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;color:#000000;background-color:#ffffff;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">To protect and where possible enhance biodiversity leading to a net gain.</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-a9eed251-7fff-d877-18c1-dffc25269b3a"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Arial;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">&nbsp;</span></p>

<p>Full details of the planting scheme illustrated on the approved drawings shall be submitted
to for approval in writing by the Local Planning Authority within 1 month of the date of this
decision. The scheme shall show the type of plant/shrubbery species, and the amount of
individual plants, and shall be carried out and implemented on site within a period of four
months from the date of this approval and shall be maintained to the satisfaction of the Local
Planning Authority, such maintenance is to include the replacement of any plants that die, or
are severely damaged, seriously diseased, or removed.
</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the pergola is satisfactory and does not
detract from the character and visual amenity of the site and surrounding area .<br></p>
